title: Square sans Nike font in Sparq Magazine
content:
[http://img92.imageshack.us/img92/7171/43315539dx0.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154447/http:/img92.imageshack.us/img92/7171/43315539dx0.jpg "http://img92.imageshack.us/img92/7171/43315539dx0.jpg")

This is another Nike Font (Sparq Magazine)

Does anyone knows any font that has this look?

Thanks a lot.
author: cariocastyle

comments.content:
(Google) Search is your friend: [http://www.typophile.com/node/44353](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154447/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44353 "http://www.typophile.com/node/44353")

It is United from House Industries.

It is not United, I am not talking about the SPARQ font I was talking about on a previous post.

This is another font used in Sparq Magazine.

Here is the pic:

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110120154447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NikeFont_4225.jpg)
Oh. Oops. The image wasn't there when I first posted. Sorry about that.

Couldn't find it yet...  
Is it so rare?

Any suggestion on any font that has the same look? THANKS.
Nope. Agency has a disconnected bowl on the cap R.
Yes, Tiffany. I was replying to the last question.

Thanks Florian and Miss.

Yeah Agency is quite different, not so elegant in my opinion. Specially for the R and B etc. But it's the closest I found so fare.. thanks.

Any other suggestion is welcome!

Well, I've seen those cuts on the cap C before. Isn't this a condensed Bank Gothic spaced really tightly? And maybe squoosed a little? The S isn't spot on, but the rest does feel similar enough to me.

There are lots of Bank Gothic version you could use. Maybe one enough feels more right for you than another.

The O W R K scream out Bank Gothic to me. Condensed Bank Gothics often use that not-rounded D (like the regular widths of Bank Gothic do). Not to mention those quote marks, which are so so so Bank Gothicâ€¦
Yeah, thanks a lot. Condensed, bold, spaced really tightly, you're right.
Steile Futura works very well too, even if different...
